what lies

                  immediately

man. The reflections serve to chequer the immediate

In pursuit of melancholy he travels over the whole world,
though he has never left his college room. We are at a remove
from the thing treated. We are enjoying the spectacle of
melancholy, not sharing is anguish.

It is here then that we develop 
                
                  facuoties
                  faculties
                 that

the play left dormant. to stop; to pause; to 
                
                  refelct
                  reflect
                ;
to Now the reader is completely in being. He can
pause; he can ponder; he can compare; he can draw back from
the page and see behind it a man sitting alone in the centre

of the labyrinth of words in a college room 
                
                  thinkinh
                  thinking
of suicide. He can gratify many different moods.
ne can read directly what is on the page, or, draing
aside, can read what is not written. There is a long drawn

continuity in the book that the 
                
                  paly
                  play
                 has not. It gives a
different pace to the mind. We are in a world where
nothing is concluded.
